Package data

Class WeatherGridDataPolygonsFactory

java.lang.Object
data.WeatherDataPolygonsFactory
data.WeatherGridDataPolygonsFactory
public class WeatherGridDataPolygonsFactory
extends WeatherDataPolygonsFactory
A WeatherGridDataPolygonsFactory is used to construct GeographicGridPolygons from the grid weather dataset.

The internally used Integer key of every position is based on the grid position.

Author:
Anton Ballmaier

  • Constructor Details

    • WeatherGridDataPolygonsFactory

      public WeatherGridDataPolygonsFactory​(java.util.Map<WeatherFeature,​java.lang.Double> features)
      Constructs a new WeatherGridDataPolygonsFactory object using the given weighted features.

      These define the feature space and it's scaling. A mapping of a feature f to the value x means: Include data about feature f in the Polygons and scale these data values by a factor of x.

      A generated GeographicGridPolygon then represents the (quantized) weather course at one position over a later specified time window.

      Parameters:
      features - the WeatherFeatures to use and how to scale them

  • Method Details

    • gridFilter

      public static java.util.function.Predicate<double[]> gridFilter​(int stepSize)
      Constructs a filter that leaves only a subgrid of the dataset. The amount of remaining positions is therefore reduced roughly quadraticly dependent on the subgrid step size
      Parameters:
      stepSize - the distance between to remaining positions in both grid coordinates
      Returns:
      the filter leaving only the subgrid of the given step size

    • idFromCalendar

      private static java.lang.String idFromCalendar​(java.util.Calendar calendar)
      Constructs a string as a time representation. The string follows the specific format "yyyymm" which is used in the names of the data files.
      Parameters:
      calendar - a time
      Returns:
      the string representation of its month

    • makeWeatherPolygon

      protected GeographicPolygon makeWeatherPolygon​(double[][] data, double[] meta)
      Constructs a GeographicPolygon from the given polygon data and additional metadata containing the latitude, longitude, elevation and grid position.

      The resulting GeographicPolygon is a GeographicGridPolygon and may be cast.

      Specified by:
      makeWeatherPolygon in class WeatherDataPolygonsFactory
      Parameters:
      data - the polygon data
      meta - the metadata, where
      • meta[0] is the latitude
      • meta[1] is the longitude
      • meta[2] is the elevation
      • meta[3] is the first grid coordinate
      • meta[4] is the second grid coordinate
      Returns:
      the constructed GeographicPolygon

    • readFeatureData

      protected java.util.LinkedHashMap<java.lang.Integer,​double[]> readFeatureData​(WeatherFeature feature, java.util.Calendar startTime, int timeSteps, int stepSize) throws java.io.IOException
      Constructs the course of all GeographicPolygons with regard to a single feature.
      Specified by:
      readFeatureData in class WeatherDataPolygonsFactory
      Parameters:
      feature - the feature for which the data should be constructed
      startTime - the start time of the time window
      timeSteps - the number of time steps
      stepSize - the time step size in hours
      Returns:
      the mapping from every available position key to the a single dimension of the corresponding polygon data
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - if the data could not be loaded

    • readMetaData

      protected java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,​double[]> readMetaData() throws java.io.IOException
      Constructs the metadata of all available positions and maps them to the positions Integer key.

      The metadata contains is structured as follows:

      • meta[0] is the latitude
      • meta[1] is the longitude
      • meta[2] is the elevation
      • meta[3] is the first grid coordinate
      • meta[4] is the second grid coordinate
      Specified by:
      readMetaData in class WeatherDataPolygonsFactory
      Returns:
      the mapping from every available position key to the corresponding metadata, where
      • meta[0] is the latitude
      • meta[1] is the longitude
      • meta[2] is the elevation
      • meta[3] is the first grid coordinate
      • meta[4] is the second grid coordinate
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - if the data could not be loaded

      private double defaultValue​(WeatherFeature feature)

      Parameters:
      feature - the feature
      Returns:
      the default value

    • downloadFromDatabase

      private void downloadFromDatabase​(WeatherFeature feature, java.lang.String id)
      Downloads the a compressed NetCDF file from the database server and saves it in the local data directory.
      Parameters:
      feature - the weather feature for which the data is required
      id - the id of the time window for which the data is required
      See Also:
      SERVER_DIRECTORY, LOCAL_DIRECTORY

    • getFile

      private ucar.nc2.NetcdfFile getFile​(WeatherFeature feature, java.util.Calendar month)
      Provides the corresponding NetCDF-file for a given month. If the file isn't present it will be downloaded first.
      Parameters:
      feature - the feature
      month - the month of the point in time for which the data is required
      Returns:
      the object representation of the requested file

    • getPath

      private java.lang.String getPath​(WeatherFeature feature, java.lang.String id, java.lang.String root)

      Parameters:

      id - the id of the point in time for which the data is required
      root - the root directory
      Returns:
      the file path

    • getRawDataArrays

      private java.util.ArrayList<ucar.ma2.Array> getRawDataArrays​(WeatherFeature feature, java.util.Calendar startTime, int timeSteps, int stepSize) throws java.io.IOException
      Returns the netCDF arrays containing the required data for a certain weather feature and time window. The returned List will only contain multiple entries, if the time window contains multiple months.
      Parameters:
      feature - the feature
      startTime - start time of the time window
      timeSteps - the number of time steps
      stepSize - the time step size in hours
      Returns:
      the required netCDF data arrays
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - if the data could not be loaded
